title: Why Central Banks Got Serious About Digital Money
dc:creator: By Carolynn Look and Bastian Benrath | Bloomberg
description: Money is edging toward its biggest reinvention in centuries. Modern technology and even the coronavirus pandemic have pushed consumers to go cashless, and with alternative concepts like stablecoins and cryptocurrencies taking hold, central banks are acting quickly to ensure they donâ€™t fall behind on innovation. The goal is a digital form of money that can compete with private-sector alternatives by being safer, more resilient and cheaper.
